IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES BEHAVIORAL RESEARCH, SCIENTIFIC, EDUCATIONAL, AND CLINICAL EXPERTISE, AS WELL AS FATIGUE RISK MANAGEMENT SERVICES FOR TRANSPORTATION AND SAFETY-SENSITIVE INDUSTRIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: IT IS THE MISSION OF THE INSTITUTES FOR BEHAVIOR RESOURCES, INC. (IBR) TO ADVANCE DEVELOPMENT OF THE BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES AND THEIR APPLICATION TO HUMAN AFFAIRS, THROUGH A WIDE RANGE OF RESEARCH, DEMONSTRATION, TRAINING, AND SERVICE PROGRAMS. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, IBR ALSO PROVIDES HEALTH, SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL SERVICES TO DIVERSE POPULATIONS IN ORDER TO RESPOND TO THE NEEDS OF SOCIETY BY IMPROVING THE SCIENTIFIC UNDERSTANDING AND APPLICATION OF BEHAVIORAL SCIENCE TO ADDRESS IDENTIFIED PROBLEMS.
IRS990.Desc: SUBSTANCE ABUSE SYSTEMS:REACH HEALTH SERVICES - Substance use disorders treatment services, REACH operates a substance use disorders treatment program in Baltimore, Maryland that provides individual and group counseling services, case management, care coordination and pharmacotheraphy services to people seeking treatment for substance use disorders. REACH also provides mental health counseling by licensed social workers to people enrolled in the substance use treatment program. Coordination of care is done with outside psychiatry providers if medication is indicated.REACH Health Services is a community based comprehensive outpatient substance use disorders treatment program designed to deliver outpatient, intensive outpatient, health home case management and population-based health services and pharmacotherapy services to those with substance use disorders in Baltimore City and the surrounding counties. The program expands access to care through the development of partnerships with existing psychosocial programs in their communities and coordinates the care with these other agencies. Current services include assessment and treatment planning, pharmacotheraphy, limited somatic care, case management, referral, and group and individual counseling services. Additional service provision is enhanced through close collaboration with local health care providers.No persons meeting Federal admission criteria will be denied admission based on race, religion, marital status, sex, age, ethnic origin, disabilities or sexual preference.In FY2023, REACH continued the SAMHSA grant which allows us to screen, treat and refer African American women and LGBTQ people with substance use disorders into care for their substance use disorder, groups and individual counseling as well as testing for Hepatitis C and HIV testing and case management. REACH began a grant working with the John Hopkins Behavioral Pharmacology Research Center for a workforce development project with the goal of assisting patients in finding employment with coaching, resume writing, skills building, and interviewing techniques. REACH also began offering the Intensive Outpatient Services again in January 2023.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Fatigue Management PRODUCTS:IBR MARKETED THE SALE OF SAFTE-FAST FATIGUE MODELING SOFTWARE, THROUGH A SUBLICENSE, TO AIRLINES WORLDWIDE AND THE NORTH AMERICAN RAIL INDUSTRY, TO HELP COMPANIES ASSESS FATIGUE AND PERFORMANCE ASSOCIATED WITH WORK SCHEDULES. SALES CAN BE IN THE FORM OF ONE OR MULTI-YEAR LICENSES OR UNDER SERVICE CONTRACTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Research: IBR's research program includes initiatives associated with developing algorithms for data collection on sleep and fatigue for wearable devices, behavioral economics as a clinical assessment tool in conjunction with reach patients and treatment for sleep-related problems associated with substance use disorders, and efforts to obtain funding for a range of studies associated with the opportunities described above.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization is exempt from Federal income tax under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. However, income from activities not directly related to the Institute's tax-exempt purpose is subject to taxation as unrelated business income. In addition, the Organization qualifies for the charitable contribution deduction under Section 170(b)(1)(A) and has been classified as an Organization that is not a private foundation under Section 509(a)(1). The Organization adopted the authoritative guidance relating to accounting for uncertainty in income taxes included in ASC Topic Income Taxes. These provisions provide consistent guidance for the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an entity's financial statements and prescribe a threshold of more likely than not for recognition and de-recognition of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. The Organization performed an evaluation of uncertain tax positions for the year ended June 30, 2023, and determined that there were no material matters that would require recognition in the financial statements or that may have an effect on its tax-exempt status. As of June 30, 2023, the statute of limitations for the Form 990 for years 2019-2022 remains open with the Internal Revenue Service. It is the Institutes policy to recognize interest and/or penalties related to uncertain tax positions, if any, in income tax expense.

OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES 4: Research: IBR's research program includes initiatives associated with developing algorithms for data collection on sleep and fatigue for wearable devices, behavioral economics as a clinical assessment tool in conjunction with reach patients and treatment for sleep-related problems associated with substance use disorders, and efforts to obtain funding for a range of studies associated with the opportunities described above.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF IBR CONSISTS OF FOUR MEMBERS, ALL WHO ARE TRUSTEES OF IBR INCLUDING THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, SUBJECT IN ALL RESPECTS TO THE AUTHORITY AND DIRECTION OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND BETWEEN ITS MEETINGS THE COMMITTEE SHALL HOLD AND EXERCISE THE POWERS AND AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES AND THE MANAGEMENT OF THE INSTITUTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The organization engages a CPA firm to prepare the first draft of the form 990 based on information provided by the organization's finance department. The first draft is reviewed by management of the organization. The form 990 is then presented to the board of directors for review. A final draft is made available to the Director of Finance who then approves the Form 990 prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: On an annual basis, all interested persons of IBR are required to sign the Conflict of Interest Statement, affirming they have read and understood the conflict of interest policy while also disclosing any current or potential conflicts of interest. If any conflicts arise, the governing board or committee shall determine by a majority vote whether the transaction or arrangement is in IBR's best interest, and whether it is fair and reasonable.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The President's compensation is determined by the board of directors and is based on industry and comparability data.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
